reviews.review_msg: Prof was completely absent from class, taught entirely by TA. No lectures, just boring dry textbook that reads like an academic journal. Class made me not want to have a job in law enforcement. Felt like only reason we were in class was so we had to buy profs textbook so he could make money off of us. Not at all what I was expecting from this class

The prof was completely absent from the class, TA basically taught us. Textbook is horribly dry and boring, no lectures just the book. The exams have questions that weren't in readings or course content. It basically feels like you are only taking this class to buy his textbook so he can make money from you. Overall, very boring and dry class.

This class was a drag and not at all what I was expecting. Extremely dry and boring content, lack of lectures or any interaction with the prof. Class was run by the TA who was a hard marker, the prof was completely absent. Exam had typos, was thrown together last minute, and had questions that were not even mentioned in textbook or readings. Avoid.

I have taken all courses offered by Rick. And from my experience, he is the best professor I had at SFU. His course involves presentation and paper based on presentation, participation, midterm and final. You really need the textbook as his exams are based on the book. He makes a lot of good jokes and guest speaker with his experience as ex-police.

Rick is great and caring prof. His exams are a bit tough but if you study hard then you will do just fine.  He is VERY approachable and is always happy to help students. He would often crack jokes to keep things interesting. He would provide students info on how to apply for jobs in law enforcement. Also his cop stories are hilarious.

Great guy, extremely knowledgable in policing. Great guest speakers (at least one every week from different departments). Tough marker though. He doesn't really lecture, however, since classes are made up of guest speakers and student presentations. So make sure you read and know the textbook inside and out since you wont have lecture notes

Funny, interesting, and intelligent guy, however, not cut out to be a professor. Some people do well in his class while others not so much. You either like or hate this guy. A very interested, animated individual who has a lot of passion for what he does. Great guy nonetheless.

I actually had Dr. Simpson for CRIM 488/489 and he was phenomenal! He gives really great feedback and advice on how to do well on assignments that I very much appreciated. He also is very approachable and gives lots of opportunities to ask questions. You can tell he cares about his students and teaches in an engaging way that's very admirable!
has a no league of legends in class policy. goat.

took this spring of 2023 and if you have even the slightest intrest in policing i would HIGHLY recommend this class. both 251 and 458 were taught amazingly and with passion. the seminar structure was new, but he made it work for everyone. papers and final project are pretty difficult and it is really important to read, but come on its a 400 lvl

Rylan is the best professor I have ever had. I have had him twice now and they were the best 2 courses I have taken. The seminar format of 458 was awesome as you can get to know one another and Rylan very well. I was a little dissapointed in how difficult he marked the final papers but other than that it was great. He had lots of great guest speaks
